intro: Hypodematium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hypodematium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 cm wide. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and grows in rocky or sandy soils. Hypodematium angustifolium is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
